item.title: Gordon Freeman's Voice
item.dc:creator: NoPetrol
item.description:
Bladex1200:

Man. That was awesome! lol

I bet the guy on the other line was either

A. Freaked out. He hid it because he wants to appear proffessional.

B. He has no idea about Half Life or its story, so he’s assuming this is a normal prank call.

If you listen to this show, all it is is talk about “paranormal subjects”. Mostly dumbfuck burnt-out hippies calling in talking about how they were abducted by aliens and bigfoot and stuff. The difference is that most of the time they actually believe what they’re saying. That’s what makes this prank so brilliant: it fits into the format of this show perfectly. Though it would have been better if he just said he worked in Anomalous Materials Research to keep it closer to the game.

Read full topic

item.title: Gordon Freeman's Voice
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
w00ties:

That clip was pretty sweet haha.

When he mentioned portal technology I believe he was still talking about Black Mesa, as they were developing portal technology as well. Although the competitor was most definitely Aperture Science from Portal, which you are right in saying was made by a team working at Valve.

Yeah. I heard that after Gabe was shown the game they were hired on the spot. Narbacular Drop was a cool game, I remember trying it out before Portal was released and I was pretty blown away myself.

Good game, never finished it though because there’s no save feature.

Read full topic

item.title: Gordon Freeman's Voice
item.dc:creator: w00ties
item.description:
That clip was pretty sweet haha.

LegoGordan:

LOL What an idiot… Portal technology i would not beleive P.S. Portal was from the creaters of half life and was mentioned here… made it more funny

When he mentioned portal technology I believe he was still talking about Black Mesa, as they were developing portal technology as well. Although the competitor was most definitely Aperture Science from Portal, which you are right in saying was made by a team working at Valve.

Brother Shrike:

Some students at Digipen University (some game school) made a senior project called Narbacular Drop. Valve liked it. They hired some of the Narbacular Drop team to make a game with a similar concept to ND. The end result was portal, as I understand it.

Yeah. I heard that after Gabe was shown the game they were hired on the spot. Narbacular Drop was a cool game, I remember trying it out before Portal was released and I was pretty blown away myself.

Read full topic

item.title: Gordon Freeman's Voice
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
Repzik:

It came from a group making a mod that VALVe liked so they were hired.

At least that’s how I remember it. Similar to Day of Defeat and Counter Strike.

Some students at Digipen University (some game school) made a senior project called Narbacular Drop. Valve liked it. They hired some of the Narbacular Drop team to make a game with a similar concept to ND. The end result was portal, as I understand it.
